purpose: The email announces a call for papers for a special issue on Agentic Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology (TOSEM) scheduled for 2026. It highlights the significant impact of AI on various branches of Software Engineering (SE) and invites original research articles on the automation due to agentic AI and its implications for future software teams. The email outlines specific categories for submissions, provides submission deadlines, and offers contact information for queries regarding the special issue.

evidence_sentences: A special issue on Agentic AI in Software is planned in TOSEM in 2026, and papers are being solicited for this purpose.
AI has had significant impact in SE affecting various branches in Software Engineering (SE) including coding, testing, analysis, patching, documentation, and even design.
This special issue will invite original research articles on automation due to agentic AI in software, and its impact on future software teams.
Papers can be under various categories, including the following.
Please select the radio button “Special issue 2025: Agentic AI in Software” in manuscriptcentral.
The submission timelines are planned as follows.
Queries about the special issue can be directed to the following editors.
